California court rules that Apple didn’t invade the privacy of iPhone users
summary: A Californian court has awarded Apple a partial victory in a class action lawsuit alleging that the company violated the privacy of some iPhone owners. The case followed a security researcher discovering data collection practices by Apple which he described at the time as “shocking” … more…

title: Scientists investigate ‘dark oxygen’ in deep-sea mining zone
summary: Startling findings in 2024 suggested that metallic nodules on the sea floor produce oxygen and might support life. Now researchers are planning an expedition to learn more and refute criticism from mining companies

title: Mars once had a vast sea the size of the Arctic Ocean
summary: Spacecraft orbiting the Red Planet have helped researchers map out an ancient coastline that surrounded a large ocean billions of years ago

title: بشهادة من دافوس.. أبوظبي نموذج عالمي في النظم الصحية الذكية
summary: نشر المنتدى الاقتصادي العالمي ورقة بحثية جديدة تسلط الضوء على ريادة أبوظبي عالمياً في مجال النظم الصحية الذكية، ونجاحها في تأسيس بنية تحتية صحية ذكية، ما يرسخ ريادة الإمارة في تطوير الابتكار والرعاية الصحية التي تركز على الوقاية.

title: Earliest ever supernova sheds light on the first stars
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has picked up the light from a massive star that exploded about a billion years after the birth of the universe

title: The science that will help you feel more fulfilled with your life
summary: January is a good time to take stock of our lives – but where to start? David Robson finds some answers in the latest psychological research

title: NASA is performing an unprecedented medical evacuation from the ISS
summary: One of the astronauts aboard the International Space Station is undergoing a “medical situation”, forcing NASA to bring the crew home early for the first time ever

title: Tree bark microbiome has important overlooked role in climate
summary: Tree bark has a total surface area similar to all of the land area on Earth. It is home to a wide range of microbial species unknown to science, and they can either take up or emit gases that have a warming effect on the climate

title: Why connecting with nature shouldn't mean disconnecting from science
summary: There is a growing trend to see our relationship with nature as a spiritual thing. This is a mistake, argues Richard Smyth

title: You can upgrade your immune system, but not in the way you think
summary: From vitamin C to your microbiome and mindset, the latest science of immunity is often counterintuitive. Here's how to give your system a fighting chance to overcome infection
